rComments: Overall she was a good prof but her lectures moved quite quickly sometimes so be prepared to type/write fast. There was a lot of reading involved and if you didn't do the readings you'll most likely get lost in the lecture sometimes. Also, she usually provided good examples of difficult topics and tried to include videos/guests as much as possible

While she talks pretty quickly, Prof. Trotz's lectures are interesting. Her topics are clear, concise and help give a great understanding of Women and Gender Studies. She is extremely open to students and welcomes input. Doing the readings for this class is extremely important, they help the lectures make sense and tutorials are reading based.

I would say that Trotz is a very knowledge professor, however, in comparison to Prof Larkin (who teaches the first half of this course), I found it very difficult to keep up with Trotz during lectures! She speaks really quickly and she covers ALOT of content during lectures. Regardless of that fact, I dont think that was a huge barrier for me!

tutorials are a big part of the course but everything was marked fairly by TAs. DONT BUY TEXTBOOK WASTE OF MONEY. most readings are online. final exam i studied and wrote the allowed cheat sheet the night before and did well. up to you to play the chance game (4 possible essays. i guessed and thankfully the 2 i guessed came up) GOOD LUCK
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Participation matters', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: From listening to her lecture, it is obvious Trotz is very knowledgeable and she seems kind. However, her lecturing style paled in comparison to Larkin (who taught first) as Trotz spoke very fast, had little to no content in slides and went off on long boring discussions. However the class assignments ,and exam are laid out and explained well.

The most inspiring and insightful professor I've had in my four year study at UofT. Her pedagogy is accessible and informative, and is above all else, enlightening. Not only is she keen on encouraging students to engage deeply, but she motivated me to look beyond the classroom to see the connection between paper to reality.

The most amazing teacher I have ever had. She is inspiring, passionate, and caring for her student and she is genuinely concerned with the quality of education she is providing. Definitely take her class, she will make your U of T experience incredible!

AMAZING Professor. She is probably the most brilliant professor I had in university so far. Always smiling and eager to help her students. I fell in love with Women Studies because of her wonderful teaching! Absolutely Phenomenal!
Trotz is wonderful. She's smart, engaging, and a critical thinker.

There are very few professors at the University of Toronto who I would care to take classes from again.  Alissa gave me faith!  She teaches with passion and with dedication. Yes, she talks a  fast, but she's open to having students ask questions to clarify concepts.  Maybe the first person who posted just didn't try talking to her personally?

I love her and Prof Larkin (another instructor of WGS160Y)!! Trotz is AMAZING. You have to pay a lot of attention in lectures as her slides do not explain much and she speaks quite fast. But her lectures are interesting and she's very friendly and helpful. You'll really look at things very differently after taking this course!

By far the best professor I had this year. Absolutely amazing - she is able to engage the class effectively, articulate her points clearly, and have class discussions in a class of 200+. She makes brilliant observations and connections across the readings. YOU SHOULD TAKE THIS COURSE!
intelligent!!!

A phenomenal Professor and person, Professor Trotz pushes students to think deeply about issues of transnationalism, global women's rights, economics but is extremely generous in the classroom and willing to engage every argument. The best part I think is that she's brilliant and able to draw together the readings with students comments! Wonderful!

Unable to explain concepts clearly. She just keep giving definitions, repeating the same sentence tons of times, and never really go deep into a discussion. Also, her voice-tone is always the same... she never changes it, NEVER!
excellent prof. passionate, marks fairly and and explains concepts well.  would take more classes from her.
No Comments

enthusiastic and passionate, approachable and helpful, facilitated discussion well in lec, clear and uses plenty of examples to illustrate points, great material! love the transnat'l perspective, guest speakers were amazing, fun, interesting class, cute as well... =) enjoyed class w/ her a lot
Trotz is an incredible teacher.  One of the best.  However, the T.A.'s, particularly Temitope, were absolutely horrible and put the who tutorial through a year of bs.

an amazing, intelligent, funny and enthusiastic professor. lectrures in a way that makes the material accessible to everyone. the only criticism would be that she is a bit rude and intimidating occasionally.
Need new T.A's. They made me hate women's studies!Q
amazing woman. great teacher.
Its interesting, but the assignments are hard. the TA's suck ass.
A LOT OF READING!!!! but a very interesting class... didn't like my T.A.
good, but a bit close minded
An amazing course... she's very passionate and helpful
Professor Trotz was my favourite professor this year.  She made me fall in love with Women's Studies and now it is my major.  Take this class!!
excellent variety on topics dealing with race, gender, class and sexuality. a bit difficult to have tutorial leaders mark all papers during the year, then have trotz mark final exam.
I switched my major from history to women's studies because of this course.  Trotz was fantastic.

Trotz's lectures are full of brilliant insights pertaining to gender, race and class issues as they affect women transnationally.  Her lectures are a bit difficult to follow, but nevertheless the content of this course changed the way I look at the world.
No Comments
